intro: Phyteuma reniforme, commonly known as the kidney-shaped phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to blue. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its stems are upright and branching. Phyteuma reniforme is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
